importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the most recent update in the 2025 postseason matchup between the Blue Jays and Mariners.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time between Game 2 and Game 7 of the ALCS, showing a critical stretch where Seattle faced adversity and the Blue Jays pushed to a decisive Game 7.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the postseason, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0 and sealing the series at 6-2.
Seattle Mariners committed three errors, including two in the second inning, leading to early runs and setting the stage for the Blue Jays’ dominance.
Toronto Blue Jays have not won a pennant in their history, making their ALCS appearance and reaching Game 7 a historic moment.
The Blue Jays’ victory forces a Game 7 in the ALCS, with the winner facing the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series.
Mariners pitcher Yesevage pitched effectively, throwing 31 splitters, getting seven strikeouts, and limiting hits and walks despite early setbacks.
The game marks the second Game 7 in Blue Jays history and their first since 1985, highlighting the team’s long wait for a championship run.
The Mariners’ season-high errors and early offensive breakthroughs contrast with Yesevage’s strong performance, illustrating the game’s pivotal nature.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2 to force a Game 7 in the ALCS, marking a significant moment in their history as they have not won a pennant since 1985.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They were eliminated from playoff contention after a series of errors and a losing effort, marking their first Game 7 in franchise history.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series (ALCS)

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They are the National League champion and will face the ALCS winner in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.

namedEntities.name: Yesevage

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a groundball that led to a throwing error by Eugenio Suárez, allowing a run to score and advancing the Blue Jays’ lead.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In a decisive 6-2 victory over the Seattle Mariners, the Toronto Blue Jays secured a spot in a deciding Game 7 of the American League Championship Series (ALCS), thanks in part to Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hitting his sixth home run of the postseason. The Blue Jays’ win was fueled by three Mariners fielding errors — two in the second inning — including one by Julio Rodríguez and another by Eugenio Suárez, which allowed early runs. Key contributions came from Addison Barger’s two-run homer and a later RBI single, while rookie pitcher Trey Yesavage delivered a strong performance with 31 splitters and seven strikeouts. The Mariners’ lone run came from Josh Naylor’s homer and a subsequent run by Randy Arozerana, but a wild pitch from Matt Brash in the seventh inning allowed Guerrero Jr. to score, sealing the game. This marks the second Game 7 in Blue Jays history and their first since 1985, while the Mariners face their first Game 7 in franchise history. The ALCS winner will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
